name: Bitdefender Vault File
summary: Learn about .BVD files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: When Bitdefender unlocks a BVD Vault, it appears as a virtual drive in the file system (e.g., "My Computer" or "This PC"). Once closed, the virtual drive disappears and Bitdefender protects the contents in the secure BVD file format once again.
NOTE: BVD stands for "Bitdefender Virtual Drive."

instructions: Bitdefender software no longer supports BVD files. You can only recover your files locked in file vaults by extracting them with older Bitdefender versions.
